body.name: The Rainbow: Absolutely heartbreaking World War 2 historical fiction based on a true story

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #54,918 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #217 in Romance Literary Fiction #443 in Historical Literary Fiction #2,371 in Historical Fiction (Kindle Store)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Poignant Holocaust Story
reviews.reviewText: I couldn't put down this historical fiction which depicts a WW II love story and deals with a young man's moral dilemma of fighting for the enemy vs helping his people. Very readable with unforeseen twists and turns in the plot.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Ignore the cover, the story is well written and engaging.
reviews.reviewText: The truth of this historical fiction is important (the Polish men conscripted) mixed with an engaging story makes for a compelling read. The book cover & simplistic subtext draw down the greatness of the novel which I highly recommend.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another tribute to bravery and love.
reviews.reviewText: Excellent. I read the Postcard a few months ago, and recognized the author’s name when I went searching for another WW 2 story…it seems to be a period of time in which we were all brave. Thank you Ms. Schabowski for keeping that bravery alive.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: What a wonderful story! It is a heartwarming tale of love during a time of heartbreak and pain. As well as a grand daughter's need to find answers and give her grandfather closure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2022
reviews.reviewText: This WWII story was from a whole different perspective than most of the stories I have read. Hitler's Army hated everyone that wasn't German and forced some into their hateful army, to do their bidding.This is the story of Tomasz, who is Polish and is forced into the German Army when an attempt to save him from being "recruited" fails. It's also the love story if Tomasz and Zophia, a love that endures throughout the war, but isn't meant to be.This story unfolds as Tomasz's grand daughter, Isla, searches for an explanation as to why there is a picture of her grandfather in a German Uniform, being awarded a medal for bravery by the Germans. Isla learns that things are not always as they seem and there are many, many secrets being hidden by her grandfather, who has dementia and is quickly forgetting his story. She makes it her mission to find out the secrets of his past so that they will never be forgotten and in doing so travels to Poland and connects with family members she has never met.I recommend having a box of tissues handy when you get to the end of the book, it had me ugly crying!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2022
reviews.reviewText: A heartbreaking story with characters that will pull at your heartstrings and a plot that will keep you enmeshed in the book. I found this one on a FB ad. Happy reading!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2022
reviews.reviewText: I do like historical fiction and this era is one of my favorites. The book had merit because there is a good back story but the present day story got repetitive and seemed awkward. The story of islas grandfather's experiences was good but also a bit too wordy and I skimmed a lot.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another great read about a terrible time in history !!!
reviews.reviewText: What a great story, again it was another look at the events that happened in World War 11. This one gives you a personal look into a family who,s life,s changed. Isla the granddaughter, wanted to know what Grandpa really did in the war, so she dug deeper, Grandma was not talking. All she wanted to know was why was Grandpa fought on the German side when he was Polish???? She had to find out, and who was the man that had the Rainbow Scarf? This story will take you to place that will all be put in place and will give Isla the answers she so needed. So she can have the peace of mind that she needed so much. Do take the time to read this book, you will enjoy the story so much.
A part of WW2 history I did not know of...gripping!

The reader is currently being swamped everyday by books based on partial if not totally true novels about the First & Second World War & following authors is sometimes a good thing or a bad ...... we will have to see. There seems to be an entertaining formula of Paris, Fighters & Bombers & their pilots. Libraries & their mysterious history books pointing to conclusions leading up to the reasons for the wars. Lost loves of the readers time window war whose Grandparents are somehow connected to undercover persons elswhere with lots of money & lost family estates in either Italy or Great Britain who do or don't live in their source land any longer. Then, without judgement or challange, the library of books tightly focusing the reader on the painfully true heavy historical emotion of the War Camps & their types of prisoners & why they were held captives together with their own personal families connections possibly in other parts of the world. Through the reading media of books that we are offered the horrific memories of that time reconnects home today to the reader & the existance of it is stongly reminded of many things from that time & sickeningly now the Ukraine the words of "Lest We Forget" will thank goodness never ever terminate.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I didn't want the Book to end , Heartbreaking, Romantic and Beautiful. The descriptions of the scenery the countryside, it's like I could smell the grass and the flowers and see the sky . On the edge of your seat with nerves. The magic of the fair the sights, the sounds the smellsAfter everything the strength, courage and bravery of everyday people is incredible
A true insight into history that should never have happened or happen again. An amazing read for many, many people.
This book had me from go, I had to find out more about it, read it cover to cover, sad but true..
